Key Match Events: Giorgi Chakvetadze raced forward and squeezed the ball under Matej Kovar to score the second goal.
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia converted a penalty that Georgia conceded after Ladislav Krejci’s eagerness to challenge him saw him concede a penalty.
Giorgi Kochorashvili broke through the Czech bodies and headed the ball out of Matej Kovar’s reach to score the third goal in just 13 minutes.
Lukas Kalvach beat Mamardashvili with a sweet strike in the 80th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Georges Mikautadze was handed his award for top-scoring at Euro 2024.
Ivan Hasek had Matej Rynes being forced off injured before the half-hour mark.
Giorgi Kochorashvili came agonisingly close to finding the bottom corner with a shot on the turn shortly after the enforced change.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia got off to a perfect start in their first second-flight campaign in the Nations League while going a fifth consecutive match unbeaten in Tbilisi.
In contrast, Czech Republic followed up their worst Euros as an independent nation with a fifth consecutive UNL defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Giorgi Chakvetadze was named the Man of the Match.
Matej Rynes was substituted early due to injury.
